analysis.Summary: Vue 3 component that renders a comments section on a user’s profile page, providing a tabbed interface to switch between the user’s own posts and the hubs they follow, and displays a Feed component for the selected tab.
analysis.Purpose: To display and manage the ‘Comments’ view under a user profile, allowing users to switch between their own posts and followed hubs via tabs and reflect the selection in the URL query parameters.

Components.name: Tab
Components.responsibility: Renders a tab bar with configurable tab labels and model binding for the selected tab.

Components.name: Feed
Components.responsibility: Displays a feed of items (comments/posts) based on the current user and selected tab context.

Functions.name: setup (script-setup)
Functions.description: Initializes reactive state, reads route parameters and query, watches for tab changes and updates the router query parameter accordingly.

Functions.name: watch(tabOrganization, callback)
Functions.description: Observes changes to the tabOrganization ref and performs a router.replace to sync the 'tab' query parameter in the URL.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The newly selected tab value ('posts' or 'hubs').

analysis.Usage: Typically registered as a route component in the router configuration for a path like '/profile/:_id/comments'. When this component mounts, it reads the current 'tab' query param (or defaults to 'posts') and syncs UI state and URL accordingly.
Notes: No <style> block is present—styling is inherited or provided globally.
The 'hubs' tab is configured but does not conditionally render a Feed; only 'posts' triggers the Feed component. Additional logic may be needed for 'hubs'.
URL synchronization via router.replace ensures the tab state persists on page reload and deep-linking.
